alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Botetourt; Craig (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Alleghany County in west central Virginia, northeastern Craig County in southwestern Virginia and northwestern Botetourt Counties in west central Virginia through 330 PM EDT... At 255 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gala, or near Eagle Rock, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oriskany... Glen Wilton... Low Moor... and Gala. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
